Entry.1:
Took over Command of No.3 Bgd. Co Divl. Train.
Company consisted of 2nd. Lieuts McTuie - Keleher and Rigby - W.O. Savage - C.S.M. Hamilton,2 M.S. Coppleston, Sec Sergts May & Dane, S. Sergts Howie, Partridge & Cooney,Farrier Sgt. Smith, S.S. Campbell (Saddler) & 109 other N.C.Os & men.

27.8.14 Broadmeadows-

Men exercised in Physical & Dismounted Drill.
2 M.S. drawing Stores etc.
2 more Drivers taken on making the strength of Coy 124.
Entry.2:
Broadmeadows

Lieut E Anderson of Tasmania an Ex Imperial A.S.C. Officer reported for duty.
N.C.Os & men instructed in Physical & Dismounted Drill.
Entry.3:
M.S. drawing Stores from Ordnance. 50 Draught Horses received from Remount Depot.
One Driver joined today making strength up to 125.
Horse No 3972 sent to Isolation Camp suffering from strangles.
Entry.4:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duty - Dismounted Drill.
Drawing Equipment.
Horse No. 4110 sent to Isolation Camp suffering from strangles.
Entry.5:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties. Riding Exercise. Rifle exercises & dismounted drill.
Entry.6:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties. Riding exercise. Dismounted drill.
Drawing Equipment.
A great deal of trouble & loss of time is experienced in obtaining equipment from Ordnance Depot.
Horse No. 4684 sent to Isolation Camp suffering with strangles,No. 4028 from lameness.
Entry.7:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties - Riding Exercise. Dismounted drill.
6 Remount Riding Horses & 32 draught horses were received from Remount Depot.
One Driver (Meaker) discharged as unsuitable - strength now 124.
Horse No. 3988 to Isolation Camp with strangles.
Entry.8:
Broadmeadows

After stable duties. Horses allotted to Sections. Riding exercise morning and evening.
Equipment & clothing coming in very slowly.
Strangles appear to be gaining ground. Nose bags numbered to accord with No. of horses & even care taken to see when feeding that horses get their own nose bag.
Entry.9:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties, each section taken in turn for riding exercise.
Lecture by W.O. Savage on Organisation of the Company, & duties of N.C.O's. Four more horses sent to Isolation Camp with strangles - Nos. 4145,4454 & 4497.
Entry.10:
Broadmeadows.

Usual Stable routine.
Shoeing horses.
Still only able to obtain small quantities of clothing &c.from Ordnance.
2 Drivers joined - Strength 126.
2 more horses Nos. 4245 & 4421 down with strangles; sent to Isolation Camp.
Entry.11:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties, Riding Exercise - Dismounted drill - obtained fresh supply of Nose bags in an endeavour to check the increase of strangles - old Nose bags thoroughly sterilised by boiling & after drying same, brushed & returned to Ordnance.
Short talks with men on theory of musketry.
Entry.12:
Broadmeadows.

Usual stable duties, riding exercises &c. Lieut E.G. Anderson reported sick attended by Dr Jolly.
Entry.13:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties. Drill & Riding exercise.
One Driver discharged as Unsuitable. Strength now 125.
Strangles still on increase. Horse No. 4408 sent to Isolation Camp.
Entry.14:
Broadmeadows.

Stables - Riding exercise -Rifle Exercises.
Lecture by self on Musketry.
One Driver joined - strength 126.
Entry.15:
Lieut Anderson sent into Melbourne Hos.
Stable duties - Dismounted drill.
Entry.16:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties - Riding Exercise &c. One Driver joined - strength now 127. Drawing Clothing & Equipment
Entry.17:
Stable duties - Riding Exercise -Fatigue duties.
Horse No. 4455 sent to Isolation Depot with Mange & No. 4881 with strangles.
Entry.18:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties, Dismounted drill. 4 Drivers & Privates joined today bringing strength up to 131.
Two horses Nos. 5322 & 4583 found to be covered with lice about the mane were thereafter sent to Isolation Camp. Grooming kits not obtainable.
Entry.19:
Usual routine duties - 8 more Draught horses received, making a total of 88.
Horse No. 4373 sent to Isolation Camp with strangles.
Entry.20:
Broadmeadows.

Usual routine. Equipment coming in slowly.
1 L.G.S Wagon received today.
Horses examined every morning, seems to be checking spread of strangles.
Entry.21:
Broadmeadows.

Stable duties. Dismounted drill.
Lecture by W.O. Savage, on fitting of saddlery &c.
1 Driver taken on, strength 132.
Entry.22:
Broadmeadows

Stable routine. Rifle exercise.
4 men discharged as being unsuitable.
Drawing equipment etc.
Shoeing horses. Horse No 3981 bad with Catarrh
Entry.23:
Stable routine. Riding exercise.
Dismounted drill.
Shoeing horses. Breaking horses in to the L.G.S. Wagon.
Entry.24:
Broadmeadows

Stables. Riding Exercises. Shoeing horses. 2 G.S. Wagons (Cooks) & one Water cart received from Sunshine Factory. 12 pairs of horses now quietened down for wagons.
Entry.25:
Broadmeadows

Stable routine. Rifle exercise. Dismounted drill. One man joined. Strength now 129.
8 More draught horses recd from Remount Depot, making a total 104.
Still quietening horses by using them in G.S. wagons. Horse No 4769 with strangles.
Entry.26:
Broadmeadows

Stable routine &c.
2 more men taken on today, making strength 131. 13 Riding horses recd from Remount Depot, making my full complement of horses.
All draught horses but one, have been exercised in pairs in Wagons.
Commenced to brand horses on hind hoofs with No of Coy. & Regt No.
Church parade held at 10 a.m.
Entry.27:
Broadmeadows

Stable routine. Dismounted drill with rifles. 4 men were discharged as being unsuitable. Strength now 127. Several pairs of horses exercised in wagons.
Entry.28:
Broadmeadows

Usual stable routine. 11 men from the 1st Reinforcements attached to No 3 making total of 138.These men are extra drivers for wagons to carry Blankets for Infantry. Branding & shoeing horses.
Horses Nos 4805, 4266, 4892 to Isolation Camp -strangles.
Entry.29:
Broadmeadows

Usual stable routine. Dismounted drill with rifles. Still endeavoring to obtain Equipment & clothing from Ordnance.
Entry.30:
Broadmeadows

Stable duties &c. 8 of the eleven men attached to my Coy. on 22nd inst now taken on the strength making total 135 of all ranks, other 3 men handed over to No 1 HQrs Coy..
Drivers warned to fall in at 11 pm to take horses to Victoria Docks, Melbourne.
Entry.31:
Broadmeadows

S.S. Farrier Smith & 18 Drivers paraded under Major Holdsworth to embark with horses on board H.M.T.S. HYMETTUS.
The whole of the Drivers of Coy. leading horses, proceeded under Lieuts. McQuin& Keleher via SydneyRoadfor the Dock at 2 a.m. to assist in the embarkation of horses on board HYMETTUS.
Lieut McQuin & party, returned per rail to Camp at 5 p.m.
The whole of the horses (except 2 sent to Remount Depot) & their equipment, were placed on board the transport.
3981, 4802, Horses No 3972, 4266, 4378, 4684, 4110, 4497, 4969, 4881, 4408 discharged from Isolation Camp Fit.
Entry.32:
Broadmeadows

2nd Lieut Rigby & a party of 10 proceeded at 6 AM via SydneyRoadto PortMelbourneto place L.G.S. , 2 G.S. wagons & water carts & saddlery on Board H.M.T.S. BENALLA. This party returned at 3 p.m.
Lieut McQuin, Drivers Hotel & ---were detained on board the transport, the Officer returned at midnight, but men remained.
Balance of Coy. cleaning up Camp.
Equipment & clothing still being drawn.
Entry.33:
Broadmeadows

Cleaning up lines.
Church parade.
Packing up stores etc. to be ready to move to Melbourne.
Entry.34:
Broadmeadows

Reveille at 5AM. Kits & stores packed on 3 2 horse lorries & sent to Show Ground at Flemingtonwhere we had to go into Camp.
Transport men proceeded by rail 8 a.m. to N Melbournethence by route march to Vic Dock to disembark horses from H.M.T.S. HYMETTUS. 567 horses were then led to Show Ground.
Entry.35:
Show Ground, Flemington

Stable duties - horses located in Stables. Cleaning rather difficultowing to all stable equipment being on board the troop ship. Dismounted drill during early part of afternoon.
Horses Nos 4454 & 4421 discharged from Vet Hos.
3 men left on HYMETTUS & 2 on BENALLA. strength at Show Ground, 130.
Entry.36:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties. Dismounted drill & leading horses around Arena for exercise. Lieut Rigby & Supply Sect of this Coy., took up the duties of supplying & transport for the whole of the troops.
3 Civilian Drivers, 6 horses & 3 lorries attached to Coy for duty.
Entry.37:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties & Dismounted drill.
Musketry & Rifle Exercise. Horses were lead during the forenoon.
Entry.38:
Show Ground Flemington

Usual duties performed today.
Q.M.S. Coppleston at Ordnance all day endeavoring to get spare parts of G.S. wagons,saddlers kit & wheelers tools.
Entry.39:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties & Dismounted drill. Lieut Anderson discharged as Medically Unfit.
Short lecture on Musketry by myself.
Entry.40:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties & Dismounted drill.
Dr. Trahar discharged as Medically Unfit.
Strength now 128 - 5 men on troop ships.
Entry.41:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties & Dismounted drill. Horses Nos. 4145,4245,3988,4148 & 4892 discharged from Isolation Camp Broadmeadows and taken on our strength.
Entry.42:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties, dismounted drill. Short lecture on Disclipline given by myself.
Entry.43:
Show Ground Flemington.

Usual Stable duties. Excercising horses. Assisting in shoeing Sydney horses.
Entry.44:
Show Ground Flemington.

Stable duties. Dismounted drill,& excercising horses.
At Ordnance to get equipment - delay & failure on the part of this Branch to satisfy Requisitions very annoying.
Entry.45:
Show Ground Flemington.

Stable duties. The whole Company turned out in afternoon & were carefully inspected by Major Marsh O.C. Div Train, who was accompanied by the Adjt. Lt. Maycock. Complimentary remarks were made at conclusion by the C.O. asto appearance, turn out, & work of Offcrs, N.C.O's & men.
Entry.46:
Show Ground Flemington.

Stable, dismounted drill, & 
supply
 lectures by Major D.P. Young to Officers on Supply work in the field.
Entry.47:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties. Church Parade.
Entry.48:
Show Ground Flemington

Stable duties. Dismounted drill. 3 Sick horses returned from Sick horse lines. 2 M. Sergt & a Corpl again sent to Ordnance to endeavour to obtain equipment & clothing - after waiting all the day a little of that required was obtained. The horses & stables were inspected by the Adjt.

Lecture at 7.30 pm by Capt Jolly A.M.C. on Hygiene.
Entry.49:
Show Ground Flemington.

Stable & dismounted drill.
Visited the Ordnance - obtained 11 rifles & final issue of breeches. Letters A.S.C. not yet obtainable. Kit inspection - many badges "Australia" & hat badges found to be missing. Shoeing the 16 extra horses
Entry.50:
Show Ground Flemington.

Stable duties. Dismounted drill.
Obtained some more information re equipment being placed on board H.M.T.S. Marere, by Sergt Parish.
Entry.51:
& 16.10. 14 Show Ground Flemington.

Usual Stable routine. Dismounted drill. Lecture on Supply work.
Major Holdsworth left for H.M.T.S. Hymettus. All Kits placed on Raily Trucks.
Dr. Atkinson 679 badly kicked by horse - removed to St Vincents Hospital.
Entry.52:
Show Ground Flemington.

Reveille 3 a.m. Last of Kits put on trucks which were removedby Raily.Dept. to H.M.T.S. Benalla (AL4). All horses 567 were led to Hymettus, by parties, butleft the ground at 7.20a.m.- men returned by route march.
Stable lines cleaned up.
This included all heavy baggage.
Chilton J. taken on strength.
Entry.53:
Show Ground Flemington.

Fatigue party consisting of the whole of the drivers put on to clean up all lines. Church Parade at 11-a.m. General leave until 10 pm. At Roll Call 3 men, viz.Quigley, FortuneJ. & Cooper J. absent. Lieut Rigby & Supply Details who have being carrying on the Depot for the Camp were relieved by Lt Mitchell & another party of men.
Entry.54:
Left the Show Ground at 9 am marched to Newmarket Raily. Stn. thence by train to Port Melbourne where we embarked on board H.M.T.S. Benalla. 
where we
 Left Wharf about 1 p.m. Lt. Rigby & party of 24led horses for 5 L.H. Train from show ground to Victoria Dock. After the 24men had hand horses over they were marched to the Karoo where they were handed over to the C.O. troops.They rejoin us in England.
Entry.56:
H.M.T.S. Benalla

Weather good, men settling down. Inspection of men & quarters each morning. Lecture given to N.C.O.s & men each afternoon, also rifle care of.
Entry.57:
Reported by Lt Col Garside to me this morning that a man in Hd QrsCoy had been placed in the Guard room previous evening for gambling. Driver Holmes the man in question was charged before me this morning & given 3 day CB. Character given GOC,V.G.
Lectures on Horse & Stable management.
Entry.58:
H.M.T.S. Benalla.

Inspection of Quarters 10 a.m. Semaphore Signalling. Lecture on Supply duty.
Entry.59:
H.M.T.S. Benalla.

Marching Order parade. Arrived Albany W.A. about 10 a.m.
